snippet: Wimbledon’s first seven days featured a huge upset, a royal visit and a perfect set. At the least, a first-time men’s finalist is sure to follow.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column assesses the Wimbledon tennis tournament as it heads into Week 2; says that Andy Murray still has a nasty draw, even without Rafael Nadal, who shockingly lost in the second round to Lukas Rosol; notes that whoever comes through will be a first-time Wimbledon finalist.
lead_paragraph: Wimbledon’s first seven days featured a huge upset, a royal visit and a perfect set. At the least, a first-time men’s finalist is sure to follow.

headline.print_headline: Wild Week Sets Stage for More Surprises
headline.seo: Wimbledon 2012 — Wild First Week Won’t End Surprises
headline.main: Wild Week Sets Stage for More Surprises
